intro: Astragalus abbreviatus, commonly known as the short-stemmed milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has compound leaves with small leaflets and produces pods that contain lens-shaped seeds. Astragalus abbreviatus is often found in disturbed or open habitats and is adapted to survive in low-nutrient conditions.
